primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of Jesus from humiliation and mockery to the definitive sacrifice at Calvary, resulting in the eternal redemption of humanity.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Master moved toward his death on our behalf
Jesus in his own clothes going to Calvary did his best
He appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself
the year of my redeemed is come
to bear the sins of many
made everything all right... for always
the Son of God, the Savior of the world
the day of vengeance is in mine heart
suffering and death for you and me
in the interest of all of our souls
travelling in the greatness of his strength
I have trodden the winepress alone

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: While the soldiers are physical, they represent the spiritual forces of mockery and the 'heavy' opponents of death and hell.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response to seeing Christ: moving from 'sham religion' to 'doing one's best'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher suggests that seeing the true Christ (Primary) should lead the hearer to act (Secondary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He appeared to put away sin
Christ was once offered to bear the sins
He died in his own clothes
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we ask, 'Lord, did I do my best?'
we must ask, 'Lord, did I do my best?'

voorbeelden: each time I preach I must ask
we want to be able to hold on to our human dignity
We need to see him as he is
Looking at Jesus as he is, we see ourselves
he has lifted us to heights sublime

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on recruitment of the will. It assumes that if the hearer truly 'sees' Christ (Savoir), they will 'want' (Vouloir) to improve.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Mockery) to ~S1 (Sham Religion) to S1 (The True Christ at Calvary).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ strips off the false garments of human mockery to reveal the definitive work of the cross.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The mockery is treated as a deep ontological humiliation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite strong moral exhortations ('did I do my best?'), the engine of the sermon is the finished work of Christ ('He did once... once for all'). The human response is framed as a consequence of seeing the Object.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Officer, choir member, usher, did you do your best?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: In his own clothes he went to Calvary and made everything all right... for always.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Edmond Spenser is used as a moral exemplar to mirror the question of 'doing one's best.'
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ's 'best' is not a model for our effort, but the substitute for our failure.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief followed by a sense of obligation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology precedes ethics, but ethics is heavily weighted toward 'effort'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical narrative of the mockery to the contemporary application of 'sham religion' is structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'It is all right now' and the urgent question 'Did I do my best?'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: to bear the sins of many

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on the 'force' of the vision of Christ rather than the indwelling Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is what Christ 'put away' through extreme suffering.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon has a strong Christ-as-Subject core but pivots to Man-as-Subject in the application phase.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer becomes the subject of 'doing their best' in a way that creates anxiety.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject of the hearer's sanctification.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because Christ did His best for us, He now works in us to produce His fruit.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the focus on being the beneficiary of the 'winepress'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that Christ gives the power to 'do our best' rather than just asking if we did.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The depiction of the mockery and the lash is sufficiently 'heavy'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) almost eclipses the 'Primary Program' (Soteriology) at the very end.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: End with the 'King of Kings' vision as the ground for hope rather than the student's question.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful narrative that successfully moves from the historical 'then' to the existential 'now' while keeping Christ's work central.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the pathos of the mockery, Greimas reveals that the 'clothes' function as actantial markers of identity and power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Roman ritual; semiotics explains how that ritual functions as an 'Opponent' to Christ's 'Object'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'sham religion' section is actually a 'Pseudo-Sender' offering false values.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'clothes' as a semiotic pivot point between humiliation and glory.
